alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 9:56AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey and San Benito. In northern California, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until noon PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM PST, doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain moving inland across the Monterey Bay region. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding, especially in low-lying and poor drainage areas where culverts may become blocked. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Gilroy, Hollister, Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Pacific Grove, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel Valley Village, Boronda, Prunedale, Spreckels, Castroville, Moss Landing, Ridgemark, Del Monte Forest, San Juan Bautista, Del Rey Oaks, Sand City and Elkhorn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
